1 A student wishes to investigate projectile motion.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 105, 874, 169]]<|/det|>
A small ball is rolled with velocity \(v\) along a horizontal surface. When the ball reaches the end of the horizontal surface, it falls and lands on a lower horizontal surface. The vertical displacement of the ball is \(p\) and the horizontal displacement of the ball is \(q\), as shown in Fig 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 183, 706, 386]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[443, 402, 509, 419]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 433, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
It is suggested that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 459, 527, 482]]<|/det|>
\[
g q^{2}=2 p v^{2}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 493, 434, 510]]<|/det|>
where \(g\) is the acceleration of free fall.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 525, 874, 573]]<|/det|>
Design a laboratory experiment to investigate how \(q\) is related to \(p\) and how \(v\) may be determined from the results. You should draw a diagram, on page 3 , showing the arrangement of your equipment. In your account you should pay particular attention to

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 587, 144, 604]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 586, 399, 604]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 616, 416, 635]]<|/det|>
(b) the measurements to be taken,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 649, 144, 666]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 648, 352, 666]]<|/det|>
(c) the control of variables,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 680, 144, 696]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 679, 356, 696]]<|/det|>
(d) the analysis of the data,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 711, 144, 727]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 710, 443, 727]]<|/det|>
